title: ARCS Motivation-Enhanced Language Advanced Learning Based on Flipped Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and intermediate or advanced academic literacy
context.additional_context: Blended learning utilizing video lectures, discussion boards, and online quizzes in non-real-time environments accessed via personal devices

learning_goals: Learners improve critical thinking by 30% when analyzing linguistic materials via flipped learning activities based on the ARCS motivation theory.

After completing weekly video lectures (attention) and pre-tasks (relevance), learners exchange peer feedback at least twice on discussion boards and achieve learning satisfaction scores of 4/5 or higher.
Learners demonstrate confidence in learning content by achieving over 80% accuracy rates through staged formative assessments (quizzes, peer evaluations).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
